title: How to Slip Stitches Onto a Stitch Holder

steps.headline: Knit your 8 stitches, or whatever the pattern calls for.

Using your stitch holder (which usually look like big safety pins), feed the long skinny metal or plastic spiky part through the stitches you just worked, from the one you knit first (or, the farthest one back on the right needle) to the nearest one/last one done.
When you have to pick those up again, you just slide them without twisting onto the left needle, closest stitch to furthest stitch.

text: Knit your 8 stitches, or whatever the pattern calls for.  Using your stitch holder (which usually look like big safety pins), feed the long skinny metal or plastic spiky part through the stitches you just worked, from the one you knit first (or, the farthest one back on the right needle) to the nearest one/last one done.  When you have to pick those up again, you just slide them without twisting onto the left needle, closest stitch to furthest stitch.
